Atomic Wallet Team Says No Drained Transactions Reported in More Than 40 Hours
Just under 48 hours after digital assets worth approximately $35 million were stolen from users of the Atomic Wallet, the team behind the decentralized wallet claimed in a tweet on June 4 that under ‚Äú1% of monthly active users have been affected/reported.‚Äù The team added that the last confirmed drain of user assets had occurred more than 40 hours earlier.

Binance.US has denied that its parent company controlled its bank accounts, but the newly disclosed bank records and messages suggest otherwise.

entry.title: The Bitcoin Standard: Celebrating 90 Years Since US Goes Off Gold
entry.summary:
Ninety years ago today, a seismic shift occurred in the global financial landscape as President Franklin Delano Roosevelt took the United States off the gold standard. This move, part of the New Deal program, was designed to tackle the economic turmoil of the Great Depression.
On this anniversary, and economic turmoil on the horizon once again, we speculate how Bitcoin could theoretically make for an ideal monetary standard.
The Gold Standard
The gold standard, for all its flaws and strengths, tied the value of most currencies (including the dollar) to a tangible, finite asset. This provided economic stability, but also limited growth and the flexibility of monetary policy.
FDR‚Äôs audacious move aimed to unshackle the economy, allowing for greater monetary control to combat deflatio‚Ä¶

entry.title: Tether Expands Investments in Green Bitcoin Mining, Invests in El Salvador‚Äôs Volcano Energy
entry.summary:
Following the company‚Äôs announcement that it will build a sustainable Bitcoin mining operation in Uruguay, the stablecoin issuer Tether has disclosed its investment in a Salvadoran bitcoin mining operation called ‚ÄúVolcano Energy.‚Äù
Tether Backs Volcano Energy
Tether is increasing its investments in recent times, having announced a mining project in Uruguay and revealing an investment in the Georgia-based payment processing company Citypay.io. The stablecoin company, responsible for the largest stablecoin asset by market cap (USDT), disclosed on Monday that it participated in a $1 billion investment in Volcano Energy, which is backed by Max Keiser.
The funds obtained by Volcano Energy will be utilized for a 241-megawatt (MW) renewable energy mining facility in Metap√°n. The data center will harness photovoltaic solar and wind power to fuel the company‚Äôs operations. Tether and Volcano Energy anticipate a substantial increase in the proportion of sustainable bitcoin mining in the forthcoming years.
üåã Energy üá∏üáª https://t.co/dqvly29BUo
‚Äî Josue Lopez üá∏üáªüá®üá≠ (@JosueLopezGal) June 3, 2023
‚ÄúVolcano Energy represents one of the most ground-breaking and strategic initiatives we are investing in and we look forward to working alongside Josue Lopez and his team to make El Salvador a global force in renewable energy production,‚Äù Tether‚Äôs CTO Paolo Ardoino said on Monday.
Josue Lopez, CEO of Volcano Energy, stated on Monday that 52% of the existing bitcoin mining operations utilize sustainable and renewable energy sources. ‚ÄúWe believe this percentage will significantly increase in the coming years, through important investments like ours,‚Äù Lopez said. ‚ÄúNot only is ‚ÄòVolcano Energy‚Äô important for the future of bitcoin resiliency, it‚Äôs also an important sign of the new crucial role that El Salvador plays in the global tech environment.‚Äù
What do you think about Tether investing in El Salvador‚Äôs Volcano Energy? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

entry.title: Montenegrin Court Reinstates Do Kwon's Bail; Dismisses Prosecutor's Appeal
entry.summary: A court in Montenegro has once again granted bail to Do Kwon, the disgraced co-founder of Terraform Labs accused of fraud in South Korea and the US, after an appeal by the local prosecutors fell through. In an announcement on Friday, the Basic Court in Podgorica said it had re-adopted the bail terms set on May 12 that states that Kwon and Terraform Labs' Chief Financial Officer, Han Chang-Joon, each pay 400,000 euros (US$428,241). Confinement under Police Surveillance Furthermore, according to the bail terms, the local police would keep the duo under strict supervision, and none is allowed to leave the apartment where they are confined. Failure to comply, the announcement added, both would forfeit their bail terms. Kwon and Han were reportedly on the run following a‚Ä¶

entry.summary:
Following the UK government‚Äôs plans to become a global hub for digital assets, lawmakers have called for comprehensive crypto regulations.¬†The Crypto and Digital Assets APPG urged the UK government to provide clear regulatory frameworks for digital assets within the next 12-18 months.
In a June 5 publication, the Crypto and Digital Assets All Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) launched an inquiry to identify key elements of digital assets policy development and challenges surrounding the regulation of the evolving asset class.
A Call For Crypto-Dedicated Regulation In The UK

entry.summary: The Unioverse is a multimedia sci-fi franchise with plans to facilitate user-generated content. Decrypt reporter and GG producer Kate Irwin checked out the Unioverse as Reyu, an alien character, and navigated the Proving Grounds with him. In the Proving Grounds, you'll fight an array of different drone-like flying robots (some have tentacles!!) as you navigate the puzzle-like dystopian environment. Alien meets Portal, anyone?

entry.title: EverQuest Producer Jeffrey Butler on How Ready Player One Led Him to Web3 Project Avalon
entry.summary: Jeffrey Butler started his game development career producing EverQuest. Now, he's Avalon's Chief Product Officer. Butler told Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how he wants to create a customizable world where users can create their own worlds and in-game content.

entry.title: Esports Orgs Should Become More Like Tech Companies: Community Gaming CEO
entry.summary: Community Gaming CEO and 3XP conference organizer Chris Gonsalves believes crypto and tech could rejuvenate and reinvent the esports industry. In an interview, he tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin why he thinks esports organizations should shake up their approach.

entry.title: SNEAK PEEK: Inside Mirandus From Gala Games
entry.summary: GG's Kate Irwin takes us on a journey inside Mirandus, the upcoming MMORPG from Gala Games.

entry.title: SNEAK PEEK: Inside Illuvium Private Beta!
entry.summary: Decrypt's GG Producer Kate Irwin offers her honest take on the Illuvium private beta, which is still in development. Take a look inside the expansive fantasy world, where RPG mechanics mix with a card-based autobattler.

entry.title: Mojo Melee Game Preview: Hands-on With the Casual Web3 Auto Battler
entry.summary: Mojo Melee is an auto battler game that offers Polygon NFTs. Decrypt contributor Ryan S. Gladwin playtested the game in beta and offers his thoughts on the gameplay experience.

entry.title: How 3XP Plans to Reshape Crypto's Reputation Among Gamers
entry.summary: Community Gaming CEO and 3XP organizer Chris Gonsalves tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the first 3XP video game conference, which aims to bring together fans of crypto-enabled video games, influencers, game developers, blockchain firms, and gamers under one roof in Pasadena, California from June 8-9, 2023.

entry.title: Mark Otero Shares Why a16z Invested in Azra Games' Approach to Gaming
entry.summary: What is Azra Games' approach to NFTs in gaming? Azra Games CEO Mark Otero shares his vision and why he believes his approach was a key reason Azra received investment from venture capital firms like Andreessen Horowitz (a16z).

entry.title: Funding Web3 Film Calladita With Traditional Systems 'Wasn't Working', Says Director Miguel Faus
entry.summary: Spanish Film Director Miguel Faus talks with Decrypt about how he financed his movie ‚ÄúCalladita‚Äù with NFTs. In his view, Web3 and blockchain allow creators to get around some of the key difficulties present in the traditional movie industry, specifically finding funding.

entry.title: 'Web3 Offers Something Hollywood Does Not': Film3 Pioneer, Filmmaker Jordan Bayne
entry.summary: Film3 pioneer, Metacannes and The Squad founder, Jordan Bayne discusses the advantages that crypto offers to filmmakers, notably owning their work's IP throughout the entire creation, production, and distribution processes.

entry.title: Film3 Offers 'a Whole Bunch of Independent Filmmakers' Hope, Says First Flights Co-founder Nick Sadler
entry.summary: First Flights co-founder Nick Sadler sat down with Decrypt at this year's MetaCannes festival to discuss how Web3 can support independent filmmakers by leveraging its unique blockchain-powered crowdfunding platform.

entry.title: The Film3 Movement 'Doesn't Need Competitors, it Needs Collaborators': Bingeable CEO, Founder Stephen Murray
entry.summary: Founder and CEO of Bingeable Stephen Murray unpacks how creators and filmmakers can lower the barriers for audiences to connect with their work. "Within two clicks on hearing about the movie, you're watching it," he told Decrypt at this year's MetaCannes festival.
